intro: Impatiens tubulosa f. omeiensis, commonly known as the Omei impatiens, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses. Its botanical significance lies in its unique floral structure and role in local ecosystems.
